function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inefficient design of large car parking leading to queues back onto the public roadway","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate provisions for disabled parking spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient land-use in parking design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for peak period movements and vehicle turnover frequency may lead to congestion and increased risk of disease transmission in the parking area","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate pedestrian safety measures at entrance and exit points may lead to increased risk of accidents and potential exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and illumination in the car parking building may contribute to poor air quality and lack of visibility, posing potential health hazards and increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deployment of secondary research approach from multiple countries increases the risk of introducing infectious disease-related guidelines or standards from high-risk areas.","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adaptation proposal for car parking buildings may overlook the integration of infectious disease control measures, increasing the risk of inadequate protection against disease transmission.","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of social distancing measures in architectural design","category":"Health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Constant changes in the environment leading to the need for adaptive architecture","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Integration of functional and technical solutions to achieve transformable design","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in building after construction requiring adaptability","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unbalanced utilization of buildings due to covid-19","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Forced reduction of quarantine period","category":"Health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Enmeshment of smart city technologies with covid-19 management strategies in global south cities","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fantasies of biological and technological fix in pandemic crisis management","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Tensions between different modes of existence of smart city technologies in pandemic management","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of covtech for pandemic management","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historical context and legacy of technologies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Homeless individuals unable to comply with lockdown rules","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Police intervention and use of force against homeless individuals","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited means and resources for the third smart city in the global south","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy in contact-tracing initiatives","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown impact of technology-enabled pandemic management strategies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of unified smart city policy in south africa","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of privacy in data tracking and monitoring","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through contact tracing and monitoring","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation and discrimination in data activism","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of state monopoly over data management may result in unregulated and uncontrolled data access and usage.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on digital platforms for managing urban data may lead to monopolistic control over urban services and data, impacting competition and innovation.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The implementation of safety and surveillance technologies in smart cities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of enumeration in informal settlements to support rights claims in terms of service risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear definition of modes of existence in socio-technical networks","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of the impact of socio-technical networks on disease propagation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on the historical trajectory of technical objects in mismanagement of complex urban systems.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistencies in truth regimes and ontological beliefs may lead to confusion and
